alert.note: Alert for Geneva; Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 18 at 12:28PM CDT until March 18 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Eastern Geneva County in southeastern Alabama... Houston County in southeastern Alabama... Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Calhoun County in southwestern Georgia... Early County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 230 PM EDT/130 PM CDT/. * At 128 PM EDT/1228 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Fort Gaines to Taylor, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Cottonwood, Fort Gaines, Headland, Dothan, Blakely, Taylor, Kinsey, Ashford, Slocomb, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Centerville, Malvern, Rehobeth, Avon, Newville, Madrid and Gordon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia.
